intro: Stigmaphyllon tomentosum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in understory habitats of rainforests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
